revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: . . .year of Emperor Titus Caesar Vespasianus Augustus, Phaophi . . ., in the record office . . . of the Arsinoite nome. Haraisis, daughter of Petesouchos . . . seventy (?) three years old, with a scar on the left cheek, with her kyrios . . . Neilos, husband of her daughter Herois . . . [years old] . . . with a scar . . . on the left . . . to her former husband Thouonis, seventy six years old, with a [l. 5] scar on the left knee, she acknowledges to have received from him the agreed upon sum of silver drachmas of the dowry immediately and from hand to hand, out of the house, the money which Thouonis owed to Haraisis in accordance with the marriage contract which was realized through this record office in the 5th year . . . [l. 10] and Haraisis (?) lives with . . .through sharing the household . . .
